metadata.title: CVE-2018-12584 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ConnectionBase::preparseNewBytes function inresip/stack/ConnectionBase.cxx in reSIProcate through 1.10.2 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow) or possiblyexecute arbitrary code when TLS communication is enabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librecon-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-turn-client-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
repro - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
resiprocate-turn-server - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
sipdialer - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: resiprocate package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1').
